data.title: EDUCATION SYSTEM IN ARMENIA
data.meta_description:
STRUCTURE OF EDUCATION
 SYSTEM IN ARMENIA
data.text:
Compulsory education lasts 12 years and consists of basic and senior secondary schools. Basic secondary education consists of primary school (4 years) and junior school (5 years). Junior school graduates are free to choose either to continue their education at senior secondary school for another 3 years or enter any vocational education institution. After 12 years, students are eligible to enter higher education and the Mijnakarg Yndhanur Krtoutian Attestat (Certificate of Secondary Education) is the prerequisite for entry. Students who successfully complete 3 years of vocational education may also enter higher education, and are required to sit entrance exams.

University level first stage : Bachelor's degree; Medical Doctor

Description:The Bachelor's degree is awarded to those having completed secondary education and four years of higher education. For medical studies, the Bachelor's degree (Medical Doctor) is awarded after a minimum of 5 years, depending on the specialization.

University level second stage : Master's degree

Description:The Master's degree is conferred to successful students after two years' further study following the Bachelor's degree. There is an integrated long cycle Master's degree (bachelor and master) in Medicine lasting six years (360 ECTS) and in Stomatology, lasting five years (300 ECTS). Clinical residency programmes are also and last between one and five years.

University level third stage : Postgraduate education

Description:A Researcher's or Candidate of Science (PhD) degree is granted to those who hold a Master's or Specialist diploma degree upon completion of three years of postgraduate studies; Candidate of Science students are required to defend a thesis.

Ministry of Education, Science, Culture and Sports

Role:Elaborates and implements the policies of the Republic of Armenia Government in the education and science sectors.

Street:Government Building 2 Vazgen Sargsyan 3

City:Yerevan

PostCode:0010

www:http://escs.am/en

Contacts:- Vahram Dumanyan (Head), Job title : Minister

- Edgar Aleksanyan (Senior Administrative Officer), Job title : Head of Department of Higher and Postgraduate Professional Education

Council of Rectors of State Higher Educational Institutions

Role:One of the two main representative bodies in the higher education systemn and an advisory body to the Ministry.

Street:Alex Manoogian Street 1

City:Yerevan

PostCode:0025

Council of Rectors of Private Higher Educational Institutions

Role:One of the two main representative bodies in the higher education systemn and an advisory body to the Ministry.

City:Yerevan

For Access to Non-University Post-Secondary Studies:The National Information Centre for Academic Recognition and Mobility is responsible for academic and professional recognition. For further information please visit:http://www.armenic.am.

For Access to University Level Studies:The National Information Centre for Academic Recognition and Mobility is responsible for academic and professional recognition. For further information please visit:http://www.armenic.am.

For Access to Advanced Studies/Research:The National Information Centre for Academic Recognition and Mobility is responsible for academic and professional recognition. For further information please visit:http://www.armenic.am.
